name: Zero water developments - achieving the ideal
location: This stream will take place in (room to be confirmed)
description: Water resource is a major challenge and we need to know how to design for highest performance standards for water management as well as understanding the principles of the water-footprint and how this can minimise risk and inform policy making. This session will explore the policy issues and offer case study examples of successful practice.

presentations.name: Cambridgeshire case study
presentations.speakers: Celeste Morgan, Sustainability Director, AECOM NW

presentations.name: Achieving zero run-off
presentations.speakers: Jeremy Jones, JRJ Consulting Chartered Engineer & Environmentalist and Advisor to Welsh Water on the Surface Water Elimination & Reduction (SWEAR) Strategy

presentations.name: The developer's perspective - Norwich case study
Water foot-printing, a tool for minimising risk and for policy making
presentations.speakers: Dr Craig Jones, Principal Associate, Sustain Ltd
